s.text: By the end of that one-hour lunch, he had listed off at least 20 projects - not the least of which was a new shelter -- and was sitting there waiting for me to respond.
Lou Barnes first met Lindsay when he served on the board of Parent and Child Development Services, where she was the human resources manager.
He and Broker later began the Mediation Center in Savannah, with both serving on the nonprofit's first board.

When the family lived in New York, Ellison says, her father got the whole family involved in the New York City Mission Society, passing on the exclusive summer camps to send his children to the society's camp for inner-city kids.

It was nine years ago and Reese-Wheeler was barely into her second week with the shelter when Lindsay, a SAFE Shelter board member, invited her to lunch to talk about "some ideas he had for the shelter."
